The members of the committee are: Pascal Arnaud, Professor of Classical Studies, University of Lyon II, Co-editor of The Sea in History – The Ancient World Michel Balard, Emeritus Professor, University Paris I-Sorbonne, Editor of The Sea in History – The Medieval World Christian Buchet, Co-editor of The Sea in History – The Early Modern World Olivier Chaline, Director of the Archaeology and Maritime History Laboratory, University Paris IV–Sorbonne, Advisor Philip de Souza, PhD, Professor of Classical Studies, Dublin University
The Early Modern World these aspects of human development

The Sea in History – The Early Modern World covers the period from around the end of the fifteenth century up to the conclusion of the Napoleonic Wars in 1815. It examines the establishment and growth of ‘the Atlantic World’, but also considers maritime developments in the Indian Ocean, Southeast and East Asia and Africa, and highlights the continuing importance of the North Sea and the Baltic. A very wide range of maritime subjects is explored
